## Description {#details}

This class encapsulates the notion of a memory block which has an address and a size.

It is used by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory">Memory</a> class (a friend) as the result of various memory allocation operations. 
<SectionUser title="See Also">
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory">Memory</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory">Memory</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/unifyloopexits-cpp/#a4741a07a0e5675f89cfed122008e0a76">block</a> abstraction.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line 32 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/memory-h">Memory.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### allocatedSize() {#a60a5600193f728ca1a0bcc9be953b158}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>size&#95;t llvm::sys::MemoryBlock::allocatedSize () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
The size as it was allocated.

This is always greater or equal to the size that was originally requested.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/memory-h/#l00040">40</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/memory-h">Memory.h</a>.
